Never Use Git Submodules - https://diziet.dreamwidth.org/14666.html

If you are interested in this complex systems stuff you can check out: How Complex Systems Fail >>> https://how.complexsystems.fail/

Complex systems (like Twitter) are engineered with redundancy, so single point failures are not enough to bring them down, and they can operate in degraded modes.

Humans are both producers and defenders against failures.

Catastrophe is always just around the corner.

Bottom line is it takes a lot of effort to keep complex systems working.

Huge overview study of effects of campaigns and debates just dropped.

Using survey data from 62 elections in 10 countries since 1952.

Conclusion: minimal effects of (television) debates.

But: not much attention to effects of social media engagement and news coverage of the debates. Bigger reach, different audiences, bigger effects?

title: Workshop: Data science in nonprofits — Data Orchard

last_post.content:
Once a month we @data_orchard hold a datafolk club.

It's a chance for data folk in nonprofits to meet each other, learn from each other and share their knowledge and skills.

It's free. It's online (on Zoom).

The next datafolk club event is on 9th March at 1pm UK time (13:00 UTC) and the topic for discussion is Data Science in Nonprofits

Sign up now https://www.dataorchard.org.uk/events/data-science-in-non-profits

Thread, long, about Boris Johnson and the UK's COVID19 response.

TLDR is: Johnson is borderline-innumerate to the point of confusing percentages and fractions and got his information from the newspapers. And six months into the pandemic he'd neglected to educate himself about the scientific basics. And a lot of people died as a direct result of his misbegotten policy decisions. https://mas.to/@kityates/109958429104381225

Any organisation that's thought about needing to improve use of #data, knows that data isn't just for 'data people'. To improve, everyone in the organisation needs to be confident about data. Our new #training course has just that in mind.

Starting 18 May: Key Data Skills for Everyone
- 1hr/week x 8 weeks
- For #nonprofit staff in non data-specific roles
- Small cohort of 10-16 people
- Delivered online
- Valuable peer networking

Book now at £499+VAT per delegate https://buff.ly/3kkIbPr

@simon_brooke @poiseunderchaos @ScotHomestead @Loukas it's very understandable to be defensive in the context of a society that's so stacked against us.

I strongly dislike 'ASD' and the whole assumption that autism is a disorder too.

I'm okay with 'disability' though, since I came to realise it *means* 'society has a responsibility to accommodate us'.

Historically, disability (particularly the social model of disability) has been the lens through which #ActuallyAutistic people have won the legal right to accommodations - as part of the wider disability rights movement.

I wrote about autism as a disability here:
https://link.medium.com/MA1lCLOwRxb

If you're still a fan of a #cryptocurrency because their #smartcontract is protected by the #blockchain, I do have bad news:

I don't know what needs to happen so that people quit promoting this #scam.

This is BIG. A new study in the Journal of the American Society of Plastic Surgeons, has highlighted a regret rate of only 0.3% for gender-affirming surgeries.

To put that into context, the regret rate for knee replacements is around 20% and plastic surgery can be up to 65%. Gender-affirming surgery... 0.3% 🤷

Yet MORE scientific research debunking the misinformation that's spread about the trans and gender diverse community 🎉 Read more on this research below ❤️

https://www.gendergp.com/new-study-confirms-regret-rates-of-gender-affirming-surgery-are-non-existent/?ma=1

title: OpenAI Is Now Everything It Promised Not to Be: Corporate, Closed-Source, and For-Profit

I believe that we won't solve the current AI debates until we take meaning seriously. Unfortunately, neither meaning nor semantics ever makes it in the news, so the general public is badly equipped to judge what is lacking in AI.

Hoping to fill a gap, I am starting a website dedicated to meaning and computation, and directed to general audiences:

https://denotation.io/about/

New content will be posted every month. Please check it out 🙂

#ai #computationallinguistics #nlp #meaning #semantics #llm

"[GPT-3] solves vignette-based tasks similarly or better than human subjects, is able to make decent decisions from descriptions, outperforms humans in a multiarmed bandit task, and shows signatures of model-based reinforcement learning. Yet, we also find that small perturbations to vignette-based tasks can lead GPT-3 vastly astray, that it shows no signatures of directed exploration, and that it fails miserably in a causal reasoning task."

#AI
#LLM

https://arxiv.org/pdf/2206.14576.pdf

title: Vattenfall Has It on Video: No Seabird Collided with Aberdeen Offshore Wind Turbines During Two-Year Monitoring Campaign

last_post.content:
2-year study yielded over 10,000 videos of birds at offshore wind farm, with no collisions or near-misses with wind turbines recorded.
Nearly all species of tracked seabirds avoided the zone of the wind turbine blades by adjusting their flight paths to fly in between turbines.

title: Politische Suchbegriffe: Medienhäuser dominieren auf YouTube

last_post.content:
Auf #YouTube füllen Videos großer Medienhäuser die Suchergebnisse zu politischen Themen. Dagegen spielen unabhängige Creator*innen kaum eine Rolle. Ein Creator sieht sich in seinen Rechten verletzt und hat sich bei der #Medienaufsicht beschwert.

Ich freue mich sehr über die Recherche: Mehrere Creators haben unsere Ergebnisse kommentiert. Und für alle, die tiefer eintauchen möchten, haben wir Rohdaten und Scraper veröffentlicht.

https://netzpolitik.org/2023/politische-suchbegriffe-medienhaeuser-dominieren-auf-youtube/

Since this modifies boot files, you kinda need to know what you are getting into... and it's obviously not recommended if you rely on your device in any capacity.

Anyways, please help us test this out so we can get it in soon! Thanks!

title: Short-term Prediction and Filtering of Solar Power Using State-Space Gaussian Processes

last_post.content: Great to see new work on #solar #PV prediction: "Short-term Prediction and Filtering of Solar Power Using State-Space Gaussian Processes" from @jack_kelly, @deisenroth & colleagues, going further into the Gaussian process approach we advocated/piloted in 2020. https://arxiv.org/abs/2302.00388

Beware of anti-myths!

Spinach *does* have a higher concentration of iron than a steak.

The problem is that it's not absorbed nearly as much when digested.

Nice read.

What next? Edge (23,34) is not really ambiguous in the Karate Club?

Crosspost from @DanLarremore@twitter.com:

New one on my list of favorite papers.

"Academic Urban Legends"

It explores the ironic follies of how we cite literature by tracing a myth: that we think spinach has a lot of iron only because of a decimal point error in the early 1900s. h/t @jugander@twitter.com

https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/10.1177/0306312714535679

🐦🔗: https://twitter.com/DanLarremore/status/1631481816057257985

title: Building reproducible analytical pipelines with R

last_post.content:
You can now pre-purchase my DRM-free #ebook (also available in PDF) for $19 (minimum price) on Leanpub!

https://leanpub.com/raps-with-r/

Learn how to build, robust, reproducible analytical pipelines using the #RStats programming language! You will learn how to use Rmarkdown to build packages, use build automation tools, Git, Docker and Github Actions as well as different programming paradigms to make your projects well-document, well-tested, and very importantly reproducible!

#reproducibility #rstats

Dropout Reduces Underfitting

Finds that models equipped with early dropout achieve lower final training loss compared to their counterparts without dropout.

https://arxiv.org/abs/2303.01500

Consistency Models

Proposes consistency models, a new family of generative models that achieve high sample quality without adversarial training.

Achieves the new SotA FID of 6.20 on ImageNet 64x64 for one-step generation.

title: Ride with GPS | Bike Route Planner and Cycling Navigation App

last_post.content:
#BikeLeans memories:
In July 2021 I had the opportunity to ride my #bicycle in the #RAGBRAI for the first time. It is pretty much a "must do" for anyone #cycling in the US Midwest. I had a great support team, rode all 505 miles across Iowa including the 114.5 mile Karras Loop and rode through both familiar and unfamiliar places. It was extremely warm most of that week, and having indoor A/C sleeping options was very helpful.
https://ridewithgps.com/collections/30639?privacy_code=9PvIgQSzWIS0zK2w
#BikeTooter

title: DS9 Garak drinks root beer (The Way of the Warrior)

last_post.content:
Quark's root beer analogy during "The Way of the Warrior" is one of the most famous dialogue scenes in all of DS9 and it only came to be, because the production crew needed a quick scene to fill some time.
It was supposed to be comedic, until Shimerman and Robinson got to act it out in a very different and intriguing kind of way. #StarTrek https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6VhSm6G7cVk
